newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Soccer-Australia achieves their highest ever ranking.
newsitem.headline: Soccer-Australia achieves their highest ever ranking.

text.p: The Australian soccer team's unbeaten run under new English coach Terry Venables has taken the team to their highest ever world ranking.
In the latest edition issued by FIFA on Wednesday, Australia are ranked 31st in the world, two places better than their previous best achieved at last month's listings.
The new ranking comes on the back of Australia's victory in the two-leg World Cup Oceania qualifying final against New Zealand and an 11-match winning streak under Venables.
Australia's victory over New Zealand means the Socceroos will now play the fourth-best qualifier from the upcoming Asian finals for a place in next year's World Cup finals in France.
Reigning World Cup champions Brazil retained the No. 1 ranking ahead of Spain.
